number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 19, 2016
												I lay in the trenches of the german first line listening to the mortars drop and the machine gun bullets wizzing by over my head. I take brief pod shots at the enemy line but have a hard time seeing anything through the grime and smoke. Then I hear an all too familair sound.....Für das Vaterland! Attacke! Attacke! Our NCO had just ordered us to charge the enemy lines and seeing that spreading cloud of chlorine gas on the horizon sure dident help puersuade the descision. I briefly considered shooting myself in the foot or hiding behind our line somewhere but what real soldier would do that? "Screw it" I thought, and with that I bounded up out of the trenches and proceeded to run for my life hearing noise of war and whistle of bullets all around me. Knowing if I hesitated now, even for a second, I would most likely end up facedown in the mud. Reminding myself of the noise variances akin to bullets, A hiss means its close but a snag means its a near miss. If you hear the latter then you better hit the ground like a fat man chasing a doughnut. Needless to say the next several minutes are a blurr of mud, screams, and smoke. Seeing several of my comrades fall in front of me and not get up again, knowing I might soon be joining them I close the bolt on my Grewher 98 as I get close enough to the enemy line to see heads moving about. Several of my fellows in a foxhole beside me raise up to run into the enemy trench which lay devestated from artillery fire, I notice movement in front of me. Several brits had rose up to take shots at my allies. I expose myself out of my fox hole and pick them off using 3 of my 5 shots earning myself 4 kills, as one of my bullets had went through my enemies neck and into his NCO behind him,  I see my friends scramble into the trench all safe from the horrors of No Mans Land. Then I see more movement on my right and turn to see the barrel of a MG sticking out amonst the sandbags. I close my eyes muttering a curse under my breath and accept my fate as I hear the sound of the machine gun open fire.I reopen my eyes and find myself back in the trench I had just fought my way out of just to do it all over again. Except now the enemy was charging us.9/10 would die for my friends againP.S. Listen to a Sabaton playlist while playing this, its OP as ♥♥♥♥ >:D

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 4, 2016
												Verdun is a game that really aims to be a realistic depiction of how war was fought during WW1. I think in that respect it succeeds brilliantly. This is trench warfare as it really must have been: - waiting around for the enemy, and then getting shot in the head from somewhere you never saw coming. - going "over the top" of the trench on command of your squad leader, and getting mowed down almost instantly.- Capturing an area, only to be hammered with chemical gasses- putting on your gas mask, obstructing your visibility so you can hardly see where (or who) you are shooting.The gameplay is brutal and unforgiving, but hey, this is war! I love how the game doesn't make it "arcady" or easy. This makes it all the more rewarding when you get to kill someone. The graphics and lighting are really nice too, being nice and muddy in the trenches, but has a good selection of more colorfull maps as well. If you are not afraid of a challenge, I recommend it!

content:
Posted: August 4, 2015
												EARLY ACCESS BUILD REVIEW!I would recommend this game to those who like the era of WW1, i would nto recommend this to anyone who is just looking for a good shooter, here are my reasons why..Cons:1.The spawn location have had no thought put into them, i cannot stress how much the spawn locations really need to be looked into, and after numerous games i have noticed i am not the only one thinking this.2.Team balancing is not thought out well enough, for example, the last game i played it was a 5vs14 player count, yet when more people joined they were put on the side with more players, yes i notice that in the top right is "asks" could a certain ammount of players join the team with the least men, needless to say no one did. This above all needs to be re-done.3.The movement of the players is a little "clunky" i would prefer it if the movement of your character was a bit mroe smoother.4.The suppression system needs to be looked at as it glitches out on more than one occasion under fire by a machine gun, over all its fine but i think the camera jump under suppression needs to be toned down a tad.Pros:1. The game gives a very good atmosphere with the crafted locations very authentic to hwo the trenches were, nicely done.2. The background sound affects are very nice (if i bit loud so you might want to turn it down), when your character moves, shouts and hold hisbreath you can tell alot of voe went into the soudn department of this video game.3. Weapon/artillery sounds are top notch, when you fire a waepon it gives a nice kick to it givign you that feel like you have fired your weapon, not like most modern shooters giving the same kick as a pee-shooter, the artillery sounds very much authentic as you can get without being in a warzone, again, much love went into the soudn design.4.Animations are also very good, reloading your rifle/pistol/machine gun or lookign through sights/binos you can see little touches that makes this game one of my top 50.5.The title menu of the video game is very very nice, moving about selecting different part fo the menu and the part of the menu where you choose where you want to battle is a very nice touch, well done devs.6.The optomisation of the video game is very good and works well on everything ive thrown at it so again well doen devs for toptomisation (I wished more early access games did mroe of it)So overall i do recommend this game to anyone who is lookign for that certain shooter for the WW1 era since there are not many, but some "kinks" do need to be worked on like the spawn locations for example, the optomisation is good and the multiple PC ive played thsi game on all run perfectly, i hope you enjoy and i hope the devs look at this review mroe as a positive rather than a negative as i do love this game.Here are the different PC's i have run it on and the frames i achieved with them (ill only cover the basic components):My DesktopAMD FX 6300 CPU (6 Core) 3.4 Ghz (Boosted to 4.1 Ghz)GTX 750 Ti 2048 Mb8Gb RAM I acheived a solid 80 frames with this on all settings high with max shadows and antialiasing.My laptopIntel Core i3 (4 Core) 2.4 GhzIntergrated graphics card (Intel HD 4000)6Gb RAMI acheived a min of 38 frames to a max of 48 frames on all Medium setting and no antialiasing.Test Rig (Not Mine)Intel Core i7 (8 Core) 5.4 Ghz overclockedGTX Titan X 1GTX Titan X 232Gb RAMI achieved a solid 180 Frames all maxed out graphics and maxed antialiasing.

content:

												UPDATED REVIEW.For anyone who actually wants to feel WW1 and actually wants to enjoy hardcore trench combat with incredibly versatile roles (about 8 squadtypes with each having 4 different classes that vary from type to type, each with their own historically accurate weapons), incredibly well thought out squad and teamplay mechanics, personal progression as well as squad progression granting you very balanced and yet great perks... this is for you. You will get your moneys worth, the community is mostly mature and the game is really encouraging teamplay without forcing your hand.This game has now become stable, populated and refined. Gore has been Added, the battles are intense and the devs are continously updating it.See you in No Mans Land.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 28, 2015
												 I'm not always a fan of instantly dying in an fps, but this game makes it fun. The visuals are great, squad play is what Battlefield tried to but could never achieve. It's such an realistic and life-like world. The ambiance and constant fighting, just creates a feeling that no game has ever given me. An MG camping the top of a hill doesn't feel like a bs/unfair tactic as that's how WW1 was. Also the progression system isn't like any of that f2p progression bs where it takes a full year of playing before you get your next weapon. In addition the battle phase system is very polished. It's a constant attack and defend struggle, and taking the enemy trench depends on if you can get there, kill the enemy, and not die yourself, but if your friends constantly die, you may get screwed when your reinforcements run out and the enemy charges ahead.All in all this game will make you enjoy and cherish every single inch that you are able to get across in no-mans land. It will make you fear the chemicals. You will know what shell shock really is (not really since it was one of the first and worst reported cases of PTSD that anyone could have at the time). Now get out there and fight! Defend your 6ft deep death trap and bury your enemies in their own. Over the top, boys!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 26, 2016
												This is ♥♥♥♥ing insane. Gut-wrenching screams everywhere, mass mutilated corpses with some still moving among the bunch, gargling, half burnt people and people with their chins blown off. This is a true representation of the horrors of the Great War. The combat is slow-paced and realistic, you actually need patience for this game. You die mostly with one shot with a rifle, 2 shots with a pistol though. Frontlines is the hardest game mode of them all, it's like you're on an actual battlefield. You have to mostly crawl and crouch your way through the map, one mistake and you're done for. Squad Defence is fun for when you want to just kill some bots without actually getting killed the instant you pop out of cover. You can stand there and farm some kills, then when you go through the trench there's a bunch of bodies just annihilated lying there and writhing. Amazing game, you should definitely buy, especially if you're into historical and realistic games that give you the sense of "Holy♥♥♥♥♥♥this guy's leg just got blown off by a grenade, better not go there". Absolutely no other game that can give you the same authenticity of the horrors of World War I.

There's gas attacks, mortars, snipers, LMG... -Friendly community Cons:-Hard at the beggining, don't worry if you die all the time-Squad system, I actually like it, but it's better with friends- Snipers are freacking impossible to use, if you can crack a kill with it you are mofo proThings you could add:- More guns-I would like to say more factions, but since the game is set in Verdun, it would probably be weird to see some Italians or Ottomans here.-I would like to see more diversity in the rolesOther than that, great game, buy now !Add me when you have done so to play with a friend :D

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 15, 2016
												A very fun, fast paced WWI trench warfare first person shooter.  The game has a unique progression system; where not only you progress through levels gaining the ability to access different weapon setups, but you also gain squad levels through playing with other players.  The more you play with the same players the higher your squad rank will progress.  These squad levels are not reset after leaving the game, but each set of players you have played with squad rank is saved and when you team up with them again your squad levels resume where you left off.  All 4 members of the squad are counted in the formula.  The action is fast-paced and brutal.  The enviroment is beautiful and the graphics are very good set at either low or a high.  If you are a fan of first person shooters or WWI or historical warfare games, this game is for you.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2016
												The historical accuracy in this game is simply wonderful, a dedicated team of developers have obviously devoted a large amount of time to Verdun and still are devoting it! The Eastern Front has been promised as a future expansion and even the game as it is now is simply great. Charging over the top of your own trench into a hail of machine- gun fire, a downpour of artillery shelling and (of course) barbed wire certainly is very captivating. This feeling is enforced by the wonderful grafics and sound effects. Now, there are still some bugs in the game, but these are rare and small things mainly. I can definately and confidently give Verdun 10/10 and it is probably the best game I have ever played.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2016
												Like Day of Defeat? Red Orchestra? GET THIS GAME!Like COD? GET THIS GAME SO I CAN PWN YOU! Verdun is a very well done look at an underexplored part of modern history. It manages to capture the futility of the western front while simultaneously making every frag seem like you won the war. Teams are big, squads are small, roles are varied. Your team will have a different set of tools at its disposal every time you play the main gameplay mode. (frontline). There is also a bolt-action deathmatch mode and more to keep you busy if frontline isn't your cup of tea du jour.  Worth the price of admission. I haven't enjoyed a shooter this much since I started playing Day of Defeat Source back when it was new. Pick this up and you'll be doing yourself a favor.

												A game set in the First Great World War!Here's a list of things you can do:-Use authentic weaponry-Have glorious moustache-Fight in trenches and defend your own-Charge at the enemy trenches-Get ordered to retreat to as soon you get there-Fail to understand the logic of your superiors-Mistake inanimate objects as enemy soldiers-Wear a gas mask-Learn what trench foot is-Call in recon planes, artillery or gas strikes-Argue history with strangers as you're making it-Appreciate modern snipers-Appreciate automatic weaponry-Sneak around in no man's land-Fail to sneak into the enemy territory-Laugh at people being attacked by barb wire-Constantly wonder where you're being shot from-Realize you aren't going to be home by Christmas-Realize you will be stuck here for another 4 years-Realize that incoming artillery wasn't called in by your NCO-Praise Prussia

												after playing this game for a few hours i can really say that i enjoy this game for its realism.This is how one of the battles i was in went. I just started a new squad with 2 other people which was a rifleman and an officer while i was a grenadier. we start the battle and we attack the trench and i throw a grenade into the trench killing a defender making that part of the trench clear. As we make our way through the trench i see a teammate get shot in front of me so i make the squad hold up and let me throw a grenade. When i threw the grenade it killed the 3 people camping there and we moved up. Then we had to defend the trench while our teammates got to the trench. The officer and rifleman set up firing positions and began killing the attackers while i was covering them. I then heard a scream and turned around to see the rifleman was shot in the throat and dying. I tld him that he would get out alive and then he died right in front of me. As he died the officer got shot in the arm by an anti tank gun and killed. I went mad and charged the sniper and suicide bombed him. Then I played Verdun! ( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												Verdun is a game that is a very impressive, and beautiful as it is the first World War 1 FPS. The game has a different kind of warfare in mind with this game. It is not in the future jumping around with jet packs. Now it is a game that is about team work, trench warfare, leadership and just over running your enemies. You will have many World War 1 weapons at your disposal, some of these are like the M08/15 heavy machine gun or the lee Enfield bolt action rifle. This game has many classes like the rifle man, the officer, the grenadier or bomber for the British and many more classes. This game has so much to offer, but it does have it's faults. The game does suffer from bad spawns this can be worked out, but also the game also get very boring at times. Sure, it is fun to run back and forth it trench warfare, but hopefully they can add more game modes, because the basic mode is very repetitive and has no replay value if you want to just do endless fighting with no rewards but only to level up in a certain class. I would say this game is an 8/10.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 24, 2014
												I have been playing since early access and the improvement I've seen in this game in phenomenal. I remember the days before gas and seeing how it being added has changed the mechanics (for the better). I feel as if this game has now developed a unique identity which  really sets it apart from other first person shooters. I really like how easy it is to die in this game, it makes you think very hard about approaching the trenches in a tactical way instead of running in a straight line as you would do in other shooters.Cover and teamwork are KEY in this game. Games need good team work otherwise it can turn into a very frustrating experience with players caring more about their kill/death ratio rather than the objective. Corporals staying in your trench when they can be used as a mobile spawn point etc.But when the players all work together it is a beautiful experience and games just fly by.Negatives I can think of;* It can look prettier (it has come a long way though)* I don't feel as if there is that much difference between guns. Unless I read which gun I'm using I'm not going to know which one it is.* I don't like the chat, it is hard to see and would rather have the placement somewhere else.*Class upgrades need to be better varied with the weapons and skills, I personally would like to see an RPG-lite like system being used but that's just me.I hope you get the game!

content:
Posted: March 30, 2016
												Trench warfare, constantly switching between attack and defence (counter attacking), variety of historically accurate battlefields, unique gameplay where every single shot matters, very high skill celling, but also easy to learn, great graphics, tactical and atmosphere, decent community and Devs that care and update their game.Verdun is a breath of fresh air in FPS industry. No more running around with SMGs spraying & praying and all that kind kind of bulls**t. Here you'll experience what it feels to crawl in a muddy trench surrounded by poisonous gas while mortars rain shells on you and pray that none lands anywhere near. You'll charge straigh into enemy fire, trying to reach their trench or any pit to take cover, and a few moments later you'll be shooting at the poor bast**ds trying to do the same. Here you'll need a sharp eye, quick thinking, bit of patience, steady aim and a pair to win.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												Verdun is a game that is a very impressive, and beautiful as it is the first World War 1 FPS. The game has a different kind of warfare in mind with this game. It is not in the future jumping around with jet packs. Now it is a game that is about team work, trench warfare, leadership and just over running your enemies. You will have many World War 1 weapons at your disposal, some of these are like the M08/15 heavy machine gun or the lee Enfield bolt action rifle. This game has many classes like the rifle man, the officer, the grenadier or bomber for the British and many more classes. This game has so much to offer, but it does have it's faults. The game does suffer from bad spawns this can be worked out, but also the game also get very boring at times. Sure, it is fun to run back and forth it trench warfare, but hopefully they can add more game modes, because the basic mode is very repetitive and has no replay value if you want to just do endless fighting with no rewards but only to level up in a certain class. I would say this game is an 8/10.

								As of july 28 2014 the game is still in a early beta-like state... but i must say its deeply interesting and something the FPS world has needed for a while now (a WW1 game) it totally flips the idea of the "call of duty" like game-play upside down. you feel totaly immersed in the game play with bombs going off and bullets whizzing past your head. i reall would like to see more from the game though, more weapon selection(so far theres only a rifle and a pistol, but it seems asthough the weapons upgrade) better render distance, the game is a big field almost and when you think you're hiding in bushes the enemy can see you clear as day. those are really the only two setbacks, keep in mind by the time you read this it may already be fixed. regardless GREAT GAME!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
Early Access Review
								for such a small game Verdun has suprisingly become one of my favorite fps games. Now I have only played the game for six ours(at the time of this review being written) but in this short amount of time Verdun keeps on impressing me. Their are two game modes one is free-for-all and the other is front line mode. In front line mode you either start out attacking or defending a trench. Every time your team is successful you get a point and get the opposite oblective of what you just had . As of now there are only four maps but those four maps have been enough for me. The game continues to deliver fun fast paced action every match. One time when defending a trench I found cover and started to shoot french soldiers charging the trench. One by one they continued to fall down until the trench was secured. Another time two of my teamates were pinned down so I went thru the trench we were attacking and when I got to the spot where the enemies were I Just started to line up the shot and took four guys out. The only negatives I could find about this game are that their can be lag there is a limited amount of weapons and their are no unlockable items (so far). Besides that I definitely recomend this game to anyone who likes fps games.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2014
Early Access Review
								The Squad based combat is original, with different roles and armies inside the same side, but sometiemes it is easy to miss the point of being in a squad (it only works if all your squad-mates are really on it). The scenarios are huge and fun, with some minor bugs (some really frustrating bugs with textures when you lay on the ground and can't aim at an enemy because you're inside a trench and the game doesn't allow you to roll or move left or right). They still have to work more in the animations of the soldiers (too simple movements) and explosions (they're ugly), and add some more realistic features (when lying in the ground you can still move while aiming, which is absolutly unrealistic). But overall, I bet this will be an amazing game when the time comes (now it's in alpha), fun to play and competitive: a good Great War version of Red Orchestra 2. They amazingly caught the atmosphere of the trenches, the crazy no-man-land battles in which hundreds die in a hundred metres, with attacks, counter-attacks and a very dynamic course of the game (capture the trench style is quite better than the old capture the flag or the "attack-defend maps"). I recommend it for RO2-RS, RO1, Arma and M&B Warband mods veterans: historically realistic and enjoyable. What's bad about it? It's still an Alpha (with some minor bugs) and the graphics aren't great (just good enough), but you already have a big and active community so you will always, anytime of the day, find squads and full servers.

content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
												You wanted to shoot an enemy? Nope, thats just a rock, and while you took your shot you gave away your position and now your brains decorate the French countryside. You wanted to charge with your budies through no mans land? Too bad, you missed a machine gunner and now you`re all dead. You wanted to sweep up a trench?, Well that guy that looked like a corpse among the other corpses was not actually dead but now, you are. These are just a few of the scenarios that you will encaunter. -You will die, a LOT. So if you are a person who rage quits, this is not for you. -Personally, I loved the game. Its the most realistic war game i have ever seen(might even give you mild PTSD :) ). -There is always someone to play with 24/7.-Known bugs that I have experienced are black trees on a single map, sommetimes all players will become immortal(i have seen this happen only 2 times), and there are some conectivity issues(the most common). That being said, these bugs are rare and will not spoil tha game for you. I found the game very educational about how cheap life was in the war, and how most of the time in a battle, you being alive is dumb luck.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 17, 2016
												I can't believe I haven't left a review for this game yet. It is a awesome WWI shooter. Don't expect to survive more than 2 hits and most of the time it is a one shot kill. Expect to die.  A LOT. When you first start out you are gonna want to go gunho as most shooters will let you. When defending, everyone lines up on the trench to drop anyone charging forward to stop them from capturing. Expect to sit in a trench for a long time killing people as bodies fill the trench. When attacking, expect the same treatment from your enemies. You need to hop from crater to crater to make it to their trenches to capture it. If you fail to capture it in time, you will need to retreat in time so you aren't executed. The game has a system that are basically killzone if you are in them for to long. Each side has different squads you can play as with four people per squad. Each squad has different roles and different weapons. Then, each role has three levels or upgrades they can have. I highly recommend this game if you want more than a run and gun shooter where accuracy is key.

"Are we downhearted? No!"Where to start with a game like this? Verdun is the first (to my knowledge) multiplayer FPS set in a realistic First World War setting, which is strangly something no one has attempted before. That being said Verdun offer a completely unique original expierence centered around immersion in a WW1 trench warfare environment. Being a bit of a history junkie myself  I found this game hard to resist and it did not disapoint.GAMEPLAY Verdun's gameplay is based (mainly) around team play, providing you and 3 other players with the ability to form one of the different squad types available to each side respectivly.

content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
												100 year anniversary of the battle of Verdun might as well do a review. Game is pretty awesome, highly recommend it. Not for run and gun shooter fans, this game takes patience, intelligence and team work. Each match plays like King of the Hill with a series of trenches, where one side defends and the other side attacks. If attackers take the defenders trench within the time limit (I think 5 minutes) then the timer is reset, and defending team has to retake their trench, if they fail to do so then they retreat to the next trench behind them. Eventually one side is either pushed too far back to their last trench, or the overall game timer runs out and the side who captured to most trenches win. The Squad system is pretty interesting, but with some issues. There are multiple squad types each having different rolls, and thus having different soldier types available, but most people play using the German Landers, French Poilues, or British Tommes squad types because they have the most streight forward soldier types in their squad; An officer who uses a pistol by default but can level up to have a rifle and can call in artillery, a Rifleman who can upgrade to be a sniper, A machine gunner who can use a machine gun (go figure), or a Grenadier who carries a lot of grenades.Apparently the squads themselves level up but from my experience once you create a squad there’s no way to find it when you stop playing and come back later. Usually I find myself joining free spots on existing squads anyway, so take this bit with a grain of salt. Overall a pretty cool Objective FPS that you can play with friends or by your self. Pros:-Great First Person Shooter, very tactical heavy requiring teamwork, brains and patience. -Straight forward role system that unlocks as you level up. -Various maps that have different challenges as you try to fight through them. -Non Toxic player community that is actually pleasent to banter with in the chat. Cons:-Player population very, sometimes its hard to get into a server, other times its deserted. -Wonky Animations, but they're still working on it. -Some LOD issues with terrain where you can sometimes see players through objects like sandbags or obstacles that are far away.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 1, 2016
												Great gameplay, great squad mechanics, great atmosphere, this game has it all.The maps are as detailed and as realistic as they can get, I never felt so vulnerable moving around the map in a game before. Getting through no man's land is a matter of luck, you run from cover to cover hoping no one will catch eye on you and be quick to aim and shoot while you're exposed. Trench sweeping is no easier, moving from corner to corner of a trench, hoping to kill the enemy behind it before he catches sight of you. You will die a lot, shot by snipers, crippled by machineguns, maimed by artillery and poisoned by gases. With enough patience and some skill, you can still be able to do the same to the enemy.This game is definitely one of the best multiplayer FPS I've ever played. Props to the dev team for the amount detail, balance, original mechanics and historical accuracy. It could be a bit more polished, but it's already great as it is.

content:
Posted: March 18, 2016
												After about a solid 100 hours in the game and im still rather a new comer to the title I feel like I can write a solid review about verdun. If your looking for a flashback of simpler times where your skill, accuracy, and timing were rewarded this may be the game for you. Growing up I would spend countless hours on cod, cod2 and all the medal of honors. Although this game is set in ww1 the core mechanics of playing verdun seem very familiar and almost nostalgic to me. The weapons are simple, upgrades make sense, squad work is essential, and everyone has their role. Objectives are very simple and are a constant tug and pull style frontlines that are pretty realistic for the time period. Maps are well designed and balanced for the most part and utilization of cover and map placement is the key to sucess in the frontlines. Graphics are impressive and youll only have a few glitchy textures at far distance but that varies from rig to rig. Sounds are pretty good aside from a few stale sounding explosions (artillery and grenades will kill you alot) but im sure theyll add more. The Historical accuracy of this game was a thing the developers took seriously and it shows, Im a huge history buff and I haven't really noticed anything a miss. The thing that is this games selling point is literally its price at only 22.99USD you can't go wrong with this game and its still in beta with a steady supply of new content. The only real downside is the games small player base or community. Late at night you'll often find it difficult to find full matches even when changing servers EU, JP, ASIA, AUS.  But im sure the games community will only grow from here.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 30, 2015
												I bought this game during this year's summer sale to experiment with my friends, and it ended up becoming my favorite shooter by far, even beating out long-time runners BF3 and CoD: MW. There's just something to be said about the harsh struggles of the First World War, with almost every weapon capable of killing in just a single bullet.The weapons are almost perfectly balanced, with perhaps the exception of the infamously mediocre Chauchat (I personally enjoy using it, though maybe not as much as the Lewis), and the asymmetrical maps offer each side an equal number of yet different vantage points and killboxes. In addition, the models are very accurate, though as Ian of ForgottenWeapons, who plays this game, will tell you, the French rifles have a slight error in their sight pictures.This game is a high-risk, high-reward team-based game. The individual can accomplish much, but without any communication many games devolve into giant stalemates, alternating between attacking and defending. That being said, even a single squad communicating within itself is enough to turn the tide, and if one manages to get the entire team on voice chat they would be nigh unstoppable. Even a single machine gunner with enough cues from his comrades is enough to suppress the entire enemy team, forestalling their advance until the next phase.Of course, every game has its downsides. For all its gameplay features, joining games with your friends is a little bit of a hassle. On the lower-populated AU server, it is nigh impossible to get your private squad into a game, instead having to rely on joining an already-existing squad and hoping no randoms join. The visuals are not something you would consider modern, and combined with some choppy animations sometimes the game looks clunky.On the whole, though, Verdun is a fresh breath into a market saturated with head-turning, three-dimensional twitch shooters and gritty military simulators, introducing both a unique setting and simple yet appropriate mechanics. I heartily recommend this game.9/10

content:
Posted: March 15
												For those of you looking for Battlefield 1 type gameplay. Leave, now. Verdun goes the other end of the gameplay spectrom and focuses on realism rather then constant fast paced action.Gameplay: the gameplay is going to probobly♥♥♥♥♥♥you off for awhile until you get the hang of how to survive no mans land for more then a second, kill a resonable amount of people, or have a positive KD. Killing is extremely rewarding in this game, it feels like you accomplished something when you land a shot, even if you die immidently after. theres a veriety of guns to use in diffrent classes and some have diffrent uses then others. dont expect to get many kills right away and spend alittle time to getting better useing rifles, granades, and maybe MG's. with rifles especially your going to miss a shot every now and again that you feel you shouldnt have missed, aswell as for some reason if you both shoot at almost the same time only one person gets hit. its kinda strange in that regard but not game breaking.Graphics: The graphics are actually really good considering it doesnt take a whole lot to run. the maps look very good although some maps are quite unbalanced or unfun. but thats just my opinion. the ragdolls are really goofy and hilarious as they curle up after getting shot like a dead spider. and the gore settings has you get shot and a limb just falls off, overall a good way to laugh even if you die.Audio: the audio is good, aswell as the quality of said audio. it can make the expirence pretty immersive at times.Bugs: the only things i can consider bugs that ive run into are the ragdolls and only one of the two people that shot one another dieing. only one of them is annoying.Overall: id probobly give this game 7/10, maybe 7.5 due to the fact the game updates regularly so the devs are still working hard to fix things and add new stuff like the scottish faction a few updates ago. i can say its worth its price and that i recomand it to people who are willing to practice a game for a few days to keep up with the online community. I personally like the gameplay versus Battlefield 1 as it is truer to actual history and is diffrent from any other FPS rather then Battlefield 1 that you just run around and shoot people and trenches dont matter at all. I recommand the shot burst of gameplay until you start to get better so you dont get to frustrated and drop the game, trust me it happens.

content:
Posted: July 24, 2015
												When i first spawned in i was in a trench with my teamates, suddenly we have the foothold and need to charge in. WE form a line and sprint in, 1..2..3..4 of my comrades fall to the ground dead. I didn't want to be the next so i jump into the nearest ditch and hide.  One of comrades tries to do teh same but gets hit and falls to the right of me. I hear a plane over head and bombs going off so i hide in this metal tube. suddenly one of the other teams members jumps down their and and mows me down. this is a 10/10 game. If you ever have any questions or wanna play together just hit me with a message!

content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
												I have Asperger's Syndrome, and as such, a very big interest in history and especially the first and scond world war.I personally feel, that there is a big, or rather enormus lack of games about The Great War, and this  game is a huge testimony that the First World War can be ag great place for a lot of game developors to explore.From thhe guns, to the sounds of the explosions and the environment, this game fells like you're rushing to your death in No Man's Land. And I like that feeling. The feeling that you can die every minute, the omnious feeling that if you don't fight, you'll die a horrendous death by the hands of your enemies.So, by all means, if you like the First World War and what I have to say about the game. Then try to look up some videos on Youtube or buuy it when it is on sale.Ps. sorry for my grammar mistakes, I was rather tired when I wrote this reccomendation. Have a good day. :D

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												If you have a thing for realism in your shooters, grittiness, squad based tactics, and enjoy a challenge, you'll enjoy Verdun.Once you get the feel for this game, it's intensity will have you hooked! I don't know if it's because you typically die in one shot, or if it's because you really have to play your class correctly for your squad to be successful, or if it's because of the setting and environment of this game within the terrible battle grounds of WWI, but this game has had me on the edge of my chair, not being able to look away for a second.I like playing as the NCO the most. Calling in mortar strikes, arty support, recon plans and gas attacks (depending on which country you're playing as). As well as supporting your men, giving orders moving up through no mans land, and staying alive for them to re-spawn on you.One of my favorite shooters right now[edit]:  The developers recently added American, Belgian and new German squads, a new map, gore, a new Co-op game mode, animations upgrade and over 40 new weapons. Woo

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								There is a lot to be said about this game, everything feels more immersive than any of the big title games like battlefield and COD there us a lot of stuff to be put into this game for instance an ANZAC faction and hopefully something along the lines of AI but even without either of those this game is still really good and worth getting there are small issues like the netcode (minor) and looking at the sky on flanders fields. but apart from those the bullet drop and the gas and the bullet travel make this game feel so much better. out of all the games i have played i give this: 10/10 for realism10/10 for historical accuracy9/10 for graphics11/10 for fun100/10 for doing a game better than any of the big game companies with many workers at their disposalGas deployed on top of me and another guy, the other guy didn't know what button puts on the gas mask and he suffocated right in front of my eyes 10/10 would gas friends again. ;)

content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								I haven't played this game for very long, but already I love it. Pros-Large sprawling maps.Brutal close quarters trench combat and tense charges across no man's land.Good squad system where coordination is important.Rewards for playing constantly with friends.Cons-Only 6 maps (they are giant though)Early ranks get pistols- not rifles.You can't remake your squad and keep leveling it across multiple sessions.

content:

Early Access Review
								Amazing game for being in BETA, I would recommend it to anybody who likes tactical shooters or is a history buff. The game is rather difficult but that makes it so much more rewarding when you finally take out the annoying enemy sniper or repel the enemy’s counterattack. Even though this game is an FPS it is based around teamwork and strategy which makes game play seems quite simple on the outside but can get very complex when you join a full server with a bunch of strangers.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								Great game so far, the only real issue is optimization and performance. I don't have an incredible graphics card, but I can run many games that are bigger than this with much better FPS. I get good framerate on this game on medium settings, BUT I get constant framerate spikes which kills the gameplay. I have seen others complain of this problem. This is probably the biggest issue for me.  Other than that, fantastic game I definitely recommend.
